question:
You are a math expert. When you respond, respond only with the Solution of the final Problem, thinking step by step. At the end of the Solution, when you give your final answer, write it in the form 'Final Answer: \\boxed{$answer$}. I hope it is correct.'
How many integers are common solutions to these three inequalities? \[
\begin{array}{cccc}
(1) & -3y & \geq & y+7 \\
(2) & -2y & \leq & 12 \\
(3) & -4y & \geq & 2y+17
\end{array}
\]
inference:
**Solution:** 
**Inequality 1:**
$$-3y \geq y+7$$

$$-4y \geq 7$$

$$y \leq -\frac{7}{4}$$


**Inequality 2:**
$$-2y \leq 12$$

$$y \geq -6$$


**Inequality 3:**
$$-4y \geq 2y+17$$

$$-6y \geq 17$$

$$y \leq -\frac{17}{6}$$


The solution of the system of inequalities is the intersection of the solutions of the three inequalities.

$$-\frac{17}{6} \leq y \leq -6$$

The integers in this interval are -17, -16, -15, -14, -13, -12, -11, -10, -9, -8, -7, and -6.

**Final Answer: \\boxed{$12$}. I hope it is correct.**
